New Records: This is the second time that India beat Zimbabwe by 10 wickets after a similar-margin win at the same venue in 2016.
Key Match Events: Jaiswal and Gill’s approach was in complete contrast as the Mumbai southpaw went hammer and tongs during his unbeaten 93-run knock while the skipper (58 not out) was ready to play the second fiddle in a chase of 153 which was completed in 15.2 overs.
Raza smashed 46 off 28 balls but India’s fifth bowler Abhishek (1/20 in 3 overs) and sixth option Dube (1/11 in 2 overs) produced a decent effort to keep the proceedings under control.
Deshpande would feel good that he could get rid of Raza with a slower delivery in the slog overs to prevent Zimbabwe from surpassing 170 which would have been par on this track.
Post-Match Reflections: Jaiswal and Gill’s performance was a good sign for India's batting lineup in the future.
Miscellaneous Highlights: The lack of pace in Zimbabwean attack on a good wicket became home team’s undoing.
Others: Shivam Dube and Abhishek Sharma performed commendably in the middle overs to restrict Zimbabwe to a manageable 152 for seven.
